source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_024_chunk1
evidence_span: Zircaloy-2 and Zircaloy-4 were irradiated in BWRs at a temperature near 561 K. Neutron fluences were at various values between 2 and 1.4×10²⁵ n/m² (E > 1 MeV)
conditions: irradiation temperature: 561 K; neutron fluence: 2-1.4×10²⁵ n/m² (E > 1 MeV); corrosion test temperatures: 589 K, 673 K, 793 K
corrosion_data: nodular corrosion eliminated at 793 K steam; uniform corrosion increased at 589 K water and 673 K steam

extra_properties.corrosion_behavior: nodular corrosion eliminated, uniform corrosion increased

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_024_chunk7
evidence_span: Zircaloy-2 and Zircaloy-4 have been irradiated in BWRs at 288°C (561 K)
corrosion_data: uniform corrosion rates increased by pre-irradiation, nodular corrosion eliminated

extra_properties.precipitate_behavior: small precipitates disappear rapidly, larger precipitates lose Fe/Ni slowly
extra_properties.solute_effect: matrix solute levels strongly affect corrosion
extra_properties.hydrogen_accumulation: potential effect on oxide growth at high thicknesses
